clean Function

clean.Rd

This function remove columns of a dataframe that provide no info (identitcal accross all rows) or disinct accross all rows. Useful to clean metadata files.

clean(tb, unique = TRUE, keep = NULL)

Arguments

tb

the data.frame or tibble
unique

whether to keep unique columns
keep

a vector of columns to keep

Examples

metaData <- data.frame(SRA = "SRA17CJQ1",
                       ID1 = sample(letters, 12, replace = FALSE),
                       group = c(rep("group1", 4),
                                 rep("group2", 4),
                                 rep("group3", 4)))
metaData$ID2 <- toupper(metaData$ID1)
metaData
#>          SRA ID1  group ID2
#> 1  SRA17CJQ1   g group1   G
#> 2  SRA17CJQ1   b group1   B
#> 3  SRA17CJQ1   e group1   E
#> 4  SRA17CJQ1   h group1   H
#> 5  SRA17CJQ1   j group2   J
#> 6  SRA17CJQ1   f group2   F
#> 7  SRA17CJQ1   i group2   I
#> 8  SRA17CJQ1   t group2   T
#> 9  SRA17CJQ1   a group3   A
#> 10 SRA17CJQ1   p group3   P
#> 11 SRA17CJQ1   v group3   V
#> 12 SRA17CJQ1   d group3   D
clean(metaData)
#>    ID1  group ID2
#> 1    g group1   G
#> 2    b group1   B
#> 3    e group1   E
#> 4    h group1   H
#> 5    j group2   J
#> 6    f group2   F
#> 7    i group2   I
#> 8    t group2   T
#> 9    a group3   A
#> 10   p group3   P
#> 11   v group3   V
#> 12   d group3   D
clean(metaData, unique = FALSE, keep = "ID1")
#>     group ID1
#> 1  group1   g
#> 2  group1   b
#> 3  group1   e
#> 4  group1   h
#> 5  group2   j
#> 6  group2   f
#> 7  group2   i
#> 8  group2   t
#> 9  group3   a
#> 10 group3   p
#> 11 group3   v
#> 12 group3   d
